text: We're currently working on the whole native notebook integration story, so hopefully that will get a lot better soonish. The plan is to have a separate kernel per notebook, so essentially when you are in a notebook, there won't be any connection to the REPL.

elements.text: We're currently working on the whole native notebook integration story, so hopefully that will get a lot better soonish. The plan is to have a separate kernel per notebook, so essentially when you are in a notebook, there won't be any connection to the REPL.

text: very nice. Looking forward to it!

elements.text: very nice. Looking forward to it!

text: Jupyter, but there is also a GSoC project for Pluto notebooks inside VS Code.

elements.text: Jupyter, but there is also a GSoC project for Pluto notebooks inside VS Code.

text: Our current thinking is that the Julia extension will provide a kernel for the Jupyter extension out of the box, so that if you have the Jupyter and Julia extension installed, you'll be able to just edit Jupyter notebooks right away without anything else.

elements.text: Our current thinking is that the Julia extension will provide a kernel for the Jupyter extension out of the box, so that if you have the Jupyter and Julia extension installed, you'll be able to just edit Jupyter notebooks right away without anything else.

text: And Pluto would be another VS Code extension, for supporting Pluto notebooks, that hooks into the Julia extension essentially to add that support.

elements.text: And Pluto would be another VS Code extension, for supporting Pluto notebooks, that hooks into the Julia extension essentially to add that support.

text: But at least from my end the priority is the Jupyter stuff.

elements.text: But at least from my end the priority is the Jupyter stuff.

text: And just to further clarify what David is saying about having "the Jupyter and Julia extension installed" it would *not* require actually installing anything jupyter related  through conda/etc.  Just those two extensions.  Python and setup free!

elements.text: And just to further clarify what David is saying about having "the Jupyter and Julia extension installed" it would
require actually installing anything jupyter related  through conda/etc.  Just those two extensions.  Python and setup free!

text: Yes, not even IJulia.jl will be needed!

elements.text: Yes, not even IJulia.jl will be needed!
